title: Composite function defined as an integral

content.question:
Let <math> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mo>.</mo> </mrow> </math>

(a) Find F'(x).

frqParts.text:
Let <math> <mrow> <mi>F</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mo>.</mo> </mrow> </math>

(a) Find F'(x).
(d) Find the length of the curve y = F(x) for 1 < x < 2.

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
